name: Caterpillar Pose (Seated Forward Fold - Yin Style)
setup: Sit on mat with legs extended straight forward
Sit on cushion or folded blanket if hamstrings are tight
Sit tall with upright spine initially
steps: Exhale and begin folding forward from hips
Allow spine to round naturally (yin style)
Let head hang heavy, arms relaxed
Hands rest on shins, ankles, or floor
Find your edge - moderate sensation in hamstrings and back
Hold still for 3-5 minutes (yin yoga timing)
Breathe slowly, allowing body to soften
Exit slowly: engage core, roll up vertebra by vertebra
cues: Let spine round - this is yin, not active stretching
mistakes: Trying to keep spine straight (this is yin - rounding is OK)
safety: Sit on cushion if hamstrings are very tight. Exit very slowly - spine may feel vulnerable after long hold. Stop if you feel sharp pain. This is a yin (passive) pose - never force.

regressions: Sit on folded blanket or cushion

prescriptionHints.notes: Yin yoga fold targeting hamstrings and entire spine. Let gravity do the work. Exit slowly.

joints.notes: Rounding spine is OK in yin yoga. Exit very slowly by engaging core. Use props generously.
